sentences.en: China has tens of millions of people living in legal limbo.
sentences.cn: 中国有数千万人生活在法律的中间状态.

sentences.en: However valid, these doubts and quibbles left the accord in limbo.
sentences.cn: 然而实际上, 诸如此类的怀疑和遁辞只会把协定打入冷宫.

sentences.en: I didn't know whether my family was alive or dead. I felt as if I was in limbo.
sentences.cn: 我不知道家人是生是死，感觉自己茫然无措。

sentences.en: I'm in limbo, waiting to know if I've got the job or not.
sentences.cn: 我心神不定, 等着知道是否已得到了那份工作.

sentences.en: Normally, officials in his position are left in limbo for weeks or months.
sentences.cn: 但通常而言, 官员会在事发后被保留职位长达数周或者数月.

sentences.en: Pass through the limbo, jump out the window.
sentences.cn: 它穿越地狱边境, 跳出窗户.

sentences.en: Reyes now finds himself in limbo.
sentences.cn: 雷耶斯现在觉得自己成了烫手的山芋.

sentences.en: Some other way of entering limbo must be thought of.
sentences.cn: 要进监狱,还得另打主意.

sentences.en: That journey will be in limbo for at least a few more weeks.
sentences.cn: 这次执教至少在接下去的几周内仍会相当困难.

sentences.en: The family was kept in limbo.
the limbo of the stateless person
sentences.cn: 无国籍人的不安定状态

sentences.en: The negotiations have been in limbo since mid-December.
sentences.cn: 从12月中旬开始谈判就一直处于停滞状态。

sentences.en: The project must remain in limbo until the committee makes its decision.
sentences.cn: 该工程必须搁置,等待委员会做决定.

sentences.en: Throughout that night I lay in the purple limbo between sleeping and waking.
sentences.cn: 我在半睡半醒的缥缈幻境中度过整晚.

sentences.en: Will they able to free themselves from this limbo?
sentences.cn: 他们能否将自己从这里解放?

words.tran_cn: 监狱；地狱的边境；放置丢弃物的场所；处于中间的或不定的状态

trans.tran_cn: [宗]地狱的外缘，不稳定，中间状态，监狱，林波舞（西印度群岛的一种舞）
trans.tran_en: a situation in which nothing happens or changes for a long period of time, and it is difficult to make decisions or know what to do, often because you are waiting for something else to happen first
